PersonalInfos.Name: Ankit Kumar
PersonalInfos.Heading: Senior Backend Developer | .NET 8 | System Architect | GDS Specialist

Summary: Backend Engineer with 3.3 years of experience. Proactively designed and implemented a next-generation .NET 8 platform architecture at EaseMyTrip, adopted as the enterprise standard. Expert in complex GDS integrations (Sabre) and legacy modernization (WCF to REST). Proven ability to deliver senior-level architectural solutions for 60+ airline providers using high-concurrency and asynchronous systems.

Education.Branch: Computer Science and Engineering (Spec. in AI/ML)
Education.Note: Completed final year degree requirements while working full-time as a Graduate Trainee at EaseMyTrip.

Responsibilities: Progression: Graduate Trainee (Sept '22 - June '23) | Software Developer (July '23 - Present).
Proactively designed the new system architecture for the .NET 8 flight booking platform (accepted as enterprise standard).
Led the migration of 60+ airline provider integrations from legacy WCF to modern .NET 8 REST APIs.
Engineered the Sabre GDS integration as a trainee, which has remained stable in production for 3+ years.
Implemented a config-driven design allowing the codebase to run as a Monolith or Microservices.
Designed high-performance manual XML/JSON parsing engines using XmlDocument and Newtonsoft.
Reduced server costs and optimized performance by refactoring blocking code into fully asynchronous I/O.
Developed an internal API testing platform that reduced manual QA effort by 90%.

Projects.Description: Architected a new system with a fresh schema to replace legacy infrastructure for 60+ providers.
End-to-end integration of Sabre SWS for Search, Reprice, Booking, and Ticketing.
Modernized legacy Windows services to cross-platform .NET 8 while maintaining parallel production stability.
Automated tool to validate provider responses and reduce manual testing cycles.
Services for automated fraud alerts, daily reporting, and currency synchronization.
